summary:
Shapeshifting is a magical power where beings can change their physical form. This ancient idea is seen in many old stories and beliefs worldwide. For example, in Finnish mythology, Louhi turns into an eagle to attack Väinämöinen. Arthur Rackham's illustrations depict magical transformations in fairy tales.

In ancient epics like Gilgamesh and the Iliad, shapeshifting plays a role. Modern fantasy and kids' books also love this concept, often featuring vampires and werewolves, who can transform into different creatures.
title: Shapeshifting
